intro: Colax parkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Colax parkeri blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white, making it a favorite among gardeners.
